original: kho bo'i phyogs la ni gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i las zad pa yin na tshe zad pa'i phyir nad de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yang gso bya ma yin par 'gyur te las zad pa yin na 'chos par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo'i phyogs la ni gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i las zad pa yin na tshe zad pa'i phyir nad de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yang gso bya ma yin par 'gyur te las zad pa yin na 'chos par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In our system, when the action that produces the state of health is exhausted, then the disease is incurable because the life force is exhausted, because it is impossible to cure it when the action is exhausted.

original: 'di ltar gal te las ma zad pa yin na 'chi ba las gzhan du yang 'chos par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang mi srid par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te las ma zad pa yin na 'chi ba las gzhan du yang 'chos par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang mi srid par bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, if the action is not exhausted, then it is possible to cure the disease even when one is not dying. But that is impossible, as is demonstrated by the words

original: tshe zad phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe zad phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the life force is exhausted.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni rgyu shi ba la sogs pa yin du zin kyang gso bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni rgyu shi ba la sogs pa yin du zin kyang gso bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if the cause of the disease is cured, it is incurable, as is demonstrated by the words

original: nyes pa 'ba' zhig yin na gso ba med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa 'ba' zhig yin na gso ba med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is a fault that cannot be cured.

original: nyes pa mi mnyam pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyus sems kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin nam rgyu 'jig na yang ji ltar 'byung ba yin thob la sogs pa 'jig byed kyis bshig pa'i bum pa ni des bshig pa yin na yang 'byung ba ma
analyzed: nyes pa mi mnyam pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyus sems kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin nam rgyu 'jig na yang ji ltar 'byung ba yin thob la sogs pa 'jig byed kyis bshig pa'i bum pa ni des bshig pa yin na yang 'byung ba ma
translated: The body that is the basis of the mind is not destroyed by the cause of the mind‚Äôs destruction, such as the exhaustion of karma and so on.

original: yin no snyam pa'i khyad par can gyi lus ni sems gnas pa'i sgrub byed du 'dod pa yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: yin no snyam pa'i khyad par can gyi lus ni sems gnas pa'i sgrub byed du 'dod pa yin no zhe na yang /

original: bden mod kyi yod pa'i sems de ni de ltar 'gyur gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyi yod pa'i sems de ni de ltar 'gyur gyi med pa ni ma yin no //

original: rgyu yang de bzhin du yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yang de bzhin du yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: And if the cause is also like that, it is not so.

original: khu ba la sogs pa rim gyis skyes pa'i sems kyi bskyed bya'i rgyu yin gyi de bzhin du skye ba nas 'jig pa gnyid log pa na rnam par chad pa'o 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khu ba la sogs pa rim gyis skyes pa'i sems kyi bskyed bya'i rgyu yin gyi de bzhin du skye ba nas 'jig pa gnyid log pa na rnam par chad pa'o 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the mind that gradually arises from semen and so on is the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising, but the cause of the mind that arises and is destroyed in the same moment is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising.

original: ji ltar rgyu yin zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu yin zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: How is it the cause?

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu dbugs 'byin pa mthong bas sems gtan rgyun chad par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu dbugs 'byin pa mthong bas sems gtan rgyun chad par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: At that time, the mind is not realized to be a continuum that is completely severed, because the result, relief, is seen.

original: de'i tshe rig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la shi bar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la shi bar zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'ang gi sgras ni rim pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni rim pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù in the verse means ‚Äúin the reverse order.‚Äù

analyzed: dug sogs kyi sogs pa'i sgra ni brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gi yin pa de de ltar yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúpoison, etc.‚Äù means that it is the cause of fainting, etc.

original: log pa'i sngags dang sman la sogs pas so //
analyzed: log pa'i sngags dang sman la sogs pas so //
translated: It is caused by the wrong use of mantras, medicine, etc.

original: de yi sos zin bcad las kyang //
analyzed: de yi sos zin bcad las kyang //
translated: Even when it is revived, it is cut off again.

original: zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni ldog pa'i rgyu gzhan te rnam grangs kyi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni ldog pa'i rgyu gzhan te rnam grangs kyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù in the verse means another cause of reversal, and it has the sense of ‚Äúalternatively.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni lus la yod pa'i sems rgyun chad pa'i du byed yin la de'i rgyu ni dug la sogs pa'i bskyed bya mi mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni lus la yod pa'i sems rgyun chad pa'i du byed yin la de'i rgyu ni dug la sogs pa'i bskyed bya mi mnyam pa yin te /
translated: The transformation of the body is the cessation of the mind that exists in the body. Its cause is the creation of an imbalance by poison, etc.

original: de dang bral na rgyu log na @245a * //
analyzed: de dang bral na rgyu log na @245a * //
translated: When that is removed, the cause is reversed, and the mind that exists in the body is revived.

original: de'i yang rgyu sos bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang rgyu sos bcad pa yin no //

original: de bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba yin na de ste shi ba zhes slar yang 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ba ni cis slar mi 'tsho ste 'tsho ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba yin na de ste shi ba zhes slar yang 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ba ni cis slar mi 'tsho ste 'tsho ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, if it is free from the cause of transformation, then if it is dead, it will not come back to life again. Why not? It would come back to life. This is the meaning.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni slar ldog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni slar ldog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What? means ‚Äúagain.‚ÄùüîΩHaving accepted the meaning of the question, ‚ÄúWhy not come back to life?‚Äù

original: cis zhes 'dri ba'i don nyid khas blangs nas cis 'tsho bar mi 'gyur zhes 'chad pa la /
analyzed: cis zhes 'dri ba'i don nyid khas blangs nas cis 'tsho bar mi 'gyur zhes 'chad pa la /

original: shi ba nyes pa mnyam gyur tshe //
analyzed: shi ba nyes pa mnyam gyur tshe //
translated: When death is the same as a fault.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis don rtogs par 'gyur ro //

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /

original: bral ba'i sems kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang bral na /
analyzed: bral ba'i sems kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang bral na /
translated: The mind that is free from the cause of destruction,

original: lus de nyid la slar skye bar mthong ba yin gyi bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: lus de nyid la slar skye bar mthong ba yin gyi bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin na /
translated: when it is free from the cause of destruction, is seen to arise again in that very body, but not in a pot, and so on.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar lus sems kyi mnyam pa'i khyad pa can ni gnas pa grub par byed pa de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar lus sems kyi mnyam pa'i khyad pa can ni gnas pa grub par byed pa de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the body is established as the abode of the mind, it is seen to be the abode of the body.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang ma yin te /

original: de ltar mthong ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

original: nyes pa 'ba' zhig ni sems rgyun chad par byed pa khas blangs pa yin na gso min med pa nyid de sems slar mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnal ma 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa 'ba' zhig ni sems rgyun chad par byed pa khas blangs pa yin na gso min med pa nyid de sems slar mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnal ma 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The only fault is that you accept that the mind is interrupted, but it is not that it does not exist, because it is not that the mind does not arise again.

original: las zad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa la ni skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: las zad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa la ni skyon 'di med do //
translated: This fault does not apply to the assertion that the exhaustion of karma is the reason.

original: lus nye bar len pa'i sems kyang 'jigs pa dang mya ngan dang 'chi ba la sogs pa cis kyang de rnam par 'gyur ba zhes ma yin yang bsgyur bya'am 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus nye bar len pa'i sems kyang 'jigs pa dang mya ngan dang 'chi ba la sogs pa cis kyang de rnam par 'gyur ba zhes ma yin yang bsgyur bya'am 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Also, the mind that appropriates the body is not transformed by any fear, sorrow, death, and so on, is it?

original: dper na rtsig ba la sogs pa mi 'gyur yang ri mo la sogs pa lag pa la sogs pa dang myu gu la gnod pa can la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa me dang phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsig ba la sogs pa mi 'gyur yang ri mo la sogs pa lag pa la sogs pa dang myu gu la gnod pa can la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa me dang phrad pa lta bu'o //

original: rtsig pa dang bum pa la sogs pa ni rnam par bsgyur bya'am bshig bya ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsig pa dang bum pa la sogs pa ni rnam par bsgyur bya'am bshig bya ma yin te /

analyzed: de nyid yin par rtogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /

original: nyer len 'gyur ba med par ni ste gang zhig gsang gi nye bar len pa yin de rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: nyer len 'gyur ba med par ni ste gang zhig gsang gi nye bar len pa yin de rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pas so //

original: nye bar len pa ni rnam pa gnyis te gnas skabs pa'i dang rgyun gyi'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni rnam pa gnyis te gnas skabs pa'i dang rgyun gyi'o //

original: nye bar len par bya ba rnam par bsgyur ba 'am gzhig par byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: nye bar len par bya ba rnam par bsgyur ba 'am gzhig par byed par mi nus so //

original: re zhig rtsig pa la sogs pa'i ri mo'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rtsig pa la sogs pa'i ri mo'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /

original: de lta mod kyi tha mi dad pa'i ljang gu la sogs pa yin te bum pa'i 'jim ba lta bu yin la de yang lag pa la sogs pas 'jig par byed pa rtsig pa ni rten tsam yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi tha mi dad pa'i ljang gu la sogs pa yin te bum pa'i 'jim ba lta bu yin la de yang lag pa la sogs pas 'jig par byed pa rtsig pa ni rten tsam yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du me dang phrad par gyur ba'i @245b bum pa las bum pa gzhan dmar por gyur ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the pot that comes in contact with fire is explained as the pot that becomes red.

original: thams cad la yang tha mi dad pa'i nye bar len pa yin te nye bar blangs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩcig shos rgyu mtshan tsam ma ma ma rgyu yang yin la re zhig sems kyi rgyu lus ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la yang tha mi dad pa'i nye bar len pa yin te nye bar blangs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te / cig shos rgyu mtshan tsam ma ma ma rgyu yang yin la re zhig sems kyi rgyu lus ma yin te /
translated: And in all cases, the support is not different from the supported, because the supported is the nature of the support.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because it is accepted as not different from the mind.

original: tha mi dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha dad pa ni rgyu yin te rtag tu de'i rjes su 'jug pas //

original: gang zhig yod pa phan 'dogs byed /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa phan 'dogs byed /
translated: What exists is the benefactor.

original: ces pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: ces pa bstan pas so //
translated: This is taught.

original: rgyu mtshan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang ma yin te /

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: lus dang sems dag ni 'jim pa dang bum pa dang gzugs bzhin du 'am tha mi dad pa yin no //

analyzed: tha dad pa la ni // gang zhig yod pas phan 'dogs byed //
translated: If they were different,üîΩthen the mind would not be the support of the body,üîΩand the body would not be the support of the mind.

analyzed: ces bstan pa yin zhing lud kyi rjes su bye pa nyid ma yin te /

translated: The body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs own nature, like a cloth is not the cause of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs special qualities, like a cloth is not the cause of the softness of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs activity, like a cloth is not the cause of the activity of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising, like a cloth is not the cause of the arising of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs abiding, like a cloth is not the cause of the abiding of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs cessation, like a cloth is not the cause of the cessation of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising, abiding, and cessation, like a cloth is not the cause of the arising, abiding, and cessation of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising, abiding, and cessation, like a cloth is not the cause of the arising, abiding, and cessation of the color of the cloth.

original: lus ni mnyam pa'i khyad par gyi shi ba'i gnas skabs dang 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus la bye brag ci yang me pa'i phyir sems mi ldog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ni mnyam pa'i khyad par gyi shi ba'i gnas skabs dang 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus la bye brag ci yang me pa'i phyir sems mi ldog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising, abiding, and cessation, like a cloth is not the cause of the arising, abiding, and cessation of the color of the cloth.üîΩThe body is not the cause of the mind, because the body is not the cause of the mind‚Äôs arising

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te nye bar blang bya ni nye bar len pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'am rgyu'i rnam par 'gyur ba las yin grang na re zhig rgyu'i rnam par gyur ba las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te nye bar blang bya ni nye bar len pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'am rgyu'i rnam par 'gyur ba las yin grang na re zhig rgyu'i rnam par gyur ba las ni ma yin te /
translated: This is taught: If the appropriated aggregates are the appropriated, then are they the appropriated due to the transformation of the appropriator or due to the transformation of the cause?üîΩFirst, they are not the appropriated due to the transformation of the cause, because they are the appropriated due to the transformation of the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa'i 'gyur ba las de 'gyur ba yin par yod pas phan 'dogs byed ces bya bas bstan pa yin la da ltar ni dngos su nye bar len pa'i 'gyur ba las rnam par 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i 'gyur ba las de 'gyur ba yin par yod pas phan 'dogs byed ces bya bas bstan pa yin la da ltar ni dngos su nye bar len pa'i 'gyur ba las rnam par 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: This is taught by the words ‚Äúthat which is helpful.‚Äù Now they are the appropriated due to the transformation of the appropriator, but not otherwise.

original: gang zhig gang gi 'gyur ba kho nar rnam par 'gyur de'i nye bar len pa yin gyi lus ni sems kyi de lta bur ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'gyur ba kho nar rnam par 'gyur de'i nye bar len pa yin gyi lus ni sems kyi de lta bur ma yin te /

original: de'i phyir sems lus kyis nye bar blang bya nyid khas blangs pas de rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin na mi 'gyur te mi 'jigs pa yin no zhes bya ba kho na legs pa yin te /üîΩgnas skabs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te lus mi 'gyur yang sems 'gyur ba yin pa de lta na de de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te / ba @246a * //

original: men la ba lang bzhin no //
analyzed: men la ba lang bzhin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir lus nye bar len pa nyid du khas blangs pa spangs par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /

original: 'gyur ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //

original: ba me na ni ba lang gi nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba me na ni ba lang gi nye bar len pa ma yin te /

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji lta autpala'i rtsa ba ba lang gi lci ba las 'byung ba bzhin du 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa'i nur nur po la sogs pa kho na las skye ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /

original: yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa ni me la sogs pas gnod par nus pa yin gyi rgyu'i ngo bo sems kyi nye bar len pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The appropriated aggregates of form, etc., are subject to harm by fire, etc., but the appropriated form of mind, which is the nature of cause, is not,

original: thag ring ba yang de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu la goms pa ji lta ba bzhin nus pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa @248a * //
analyzed: thag ring ba yang de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu la goms pa ji lta ba bzhin nus pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa @248a * //

analyzed: de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir sems ni dang por lus las skye ba ma yin te /

analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba las autpala'i rtsa ba lta bur ro zhes bstan pa ni lus las zhes bya ba'o //

original: nyer len gnod pa med par ni //
analyzed: nyer len gnod pa med par ni //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

original: sems snga ma ba nyid ji ltar goms pa'i skyed byed ni bar du chad pa nyid kyang skyed par byed pa'i phyir gnyid log pa'am gzhan yang de la gnod pa byed par nus pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩsngon gyi 'du byed la ltos can //

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

original: bar du chod pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o//

original: shi ba dang gnyid log pa dag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shi ba dang gnyid log pa dag la zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gal te goms pa las kyang sems chad pa yin na gtan rnam par chad par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar goms pa srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /

analyzed: 'on te res 'ga' zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: re zhig goms pa las byung ba'i rnam par chad pa'i sems ni mtshams sbyor ba kho nar mthong bar bstan pa ni /

translated: The teaching that it is unreasonable to observe the life-mind as only completely cut off, free from a former and later end, is:

original: sngon gyi mtha' can la ltos can //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' can la ltos can //

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar byed pa /

original: de ci 'dra zhig 'phen byed 'gyur //
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhig 'phen byed 'gyur //

original: zhes bya bas bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bstan pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni @248b de med pas rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par chad par 'gyur ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba smos te /

It is because the continuum of existence is not the object of attachment, since it is not the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

translated: In response to the question of how there is no aversion that is directed toward others, the root text states, ‚ÄúCompassion.‚Äù

original: thams cad du yongs su 'dor ba'i ngo bo'i zhe sdang ni pha rol gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir la mi phyogs pa ni de'i phyogs kho na yin par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi don la dga' ba med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yongs su 'dor ba'i ngo bo'i zhe sdang ni pha rol gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir la mi phyogs pa ni de'i phyogs kho na yin par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi don la dga' ba med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Hatred that is the nature of complete aversion is the object of another, and non-aversion is taught to be just that.

original: gal te yang dgra bcom pa la ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par chad pa yin la de med pas rnam par ma chad pa kho na srid pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: gal te yang dgra bcom pa la ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par chad pa yin la de med pas rnam par ma chad pa kho na srid pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: If an arhat is interrupted because the cause is incomplete, then it is taught that only the uninterrupted is possible, since that does not exist.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or,üîΩ

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi shes pa la kho na zhes bya bar rim pa ma yin pa'i nges par bzung ba yin no //

analyzed: thams cad du rnam par chad pa ni rtag tu rnam par chad pa yin la da ltar ba'i shes pa'i skad cig la dmigs pa ni snga ma dang phyi mas dben pa nyid kho na de rnam par chad par dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba ni bdag cag
translated: Complete interruption is always interrupted. The present moment of consciousness is observed to be isolated from the past and future. That is the observation of interruption.üîΩWe

original: gi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gi 'dod pa yin no //

original: zhes bya ba ste /

translated: It is our belief that the mind is neither the same nor different in the beginning and end, but it is not the case that we do not observe anything else.

original: ma mthong ba ni med pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni med pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that nonseeing is not a proof of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyi blo gnas pa yi rten //
analyzed: de'i phyi blo gnas pa yi rten //
translated: The support of the mind that abides in that

original: blo nyid la ni brten pa 'ga' //
analyzed: blo nyid la ni brten pa 'ga' //
translated: is not supported by anything at all.üîΩAnd:

original: zhes bya ba dang / de yi shes pas phan 'dogs phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de yi shes pas phan 'dogs phyir //
translated: Because the mind is benefited by that knowledge,

original: yod na lus la brten par bshad //
analyzed: yod na lus la brten par bshad //
translated: If it does exist, it is explained as being dependent on the body.

original: ces kyang gsungs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ces kyang gsungs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: rten ldog pas @249a * // ldog pa ni bzlog du med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cessation of the body does not cause the cessation of the mind.

analyzed: gal te lus kyi nye bar blang bya sems yin na lus rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa /
translated: If the mind is the appropriated object of the body, then the mind would not cease when the body ceases, that is, when it is destroyed.

original: shi ba'i gnas skabs na yang mi ldog par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te ldog na ni lus kyi nye bar blang bya ma yin te /
analyzed: shi ba'i gnas skabs na yang mi ldog par 'gyur ro // 'on te ldog na ni lus kyi nye bar blang bya ma yin te /
translated: It would not cease even in the state of death.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if it does cease, then it is not the appropriated object of the body, because they are different.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don yin no //

analyzed: 'on te sems tha dad pa yin yang de 'di'i rten yin gyi ba lang la sogs pa bzhin du rang dbang ni ma yin no //
translated: But even if the mind is different, it is the support of the body, not independent like a cow or a horse.

analyzed: de'i phyir ri mo bzhin du rten log na'am gzhan du yang ldog par byed pa nye bar zhugs pas ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like a painting, the mind ceases when the support ceases or changes, because the cause of its cessation is present.

original: de'i phyir lus med na ldog par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /

analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyus 'jig pa ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag tu mi rigs pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan med pa ni dngos po'i chos kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is illogical that destruction is produced by a cause of impermanence, whether it is different or not different, the absence of another cause is taught to be a property of things themselves.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, destruction is alsoüîΩa property of things themselves.

original: rtsod pa ni don 'di dag dngos po'i chos nyid ces bya ba de kho na lan bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni don 'di dag dngos po'i chos nyid ces bya ba de kho na lan bzlas pa yin no //
translated: The dispute is this: ‚ÄúThese things are called the ‚Äòintrinsic reality‚Äô of things.‚Äù

original: phyogs 'di la yang gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya zhes bya ba rgyu kho na 'jog byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la yang gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya zhes bya ba rgyu kho na 'jog byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the use of positing a cause in this case? The point is that a cause is not the only thing that posits something.

original: yang na dus gcig kho na des de ltar bskyed pa yin na yang des ci dgos zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig kho na des de ltar bskyed pa yin na yang des ci dgos zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Or, if it is produced by that in just one moment, what is the use of that?

original: yang na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the following:üîΩOr, if it is produced by that in just one moment, what is the use of that?

original: dus tha dad pa'i chu la sogs pa'i rten bum pa la sogs ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i chu la sogs pa'i rten bum pa la sogs ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt such things as a pot, which are the supports of such things as water that exist at different times, impermanent?

original: de'i tshe 'bo ba'i phyir bo ba la ni rten yod pa ma yin na ji ltar mi 'bo ba bo ba'i rten yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bo ba'i phyir bo ba la ni rten yod pa ma yin na ji ltar mi 'bo ba bo ba'i rten yin /
translated: In that case, since it falls, it does not have a support. How could an impermanent thing be the support of a permanent thing?

original: dngos po gzhan lhan cig byed pa las de nyid la de dang lhan cig byed pa nyid ni lhan cig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan lhan cig byed pa las de nyid la de dang lhan cig byed pa nyid ni lhan cig pa nyid yin te /
translated: The simultaneity of a thing that is a co-arisen cause in dependence on another thing is the simultaneity of that thing.

original: lhan cig pa ni mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir rten nyid rgyu ma yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig pa ni mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir rten nyid rgyu ma yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: Since a simultaneous thing does not fall, it is established that it is not a cause.

original: 'on te lhan cig pa ma yin pa yang lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na ni de rtag tu yod pa'i phyir rtag tu mi ltung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig pa ma yin pa yang lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na ni de rtag tu yod pa'i phyir rtag tu mi ltung par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that which is not simultaneous is a cooperative condition, then it would never fall, because it would always exist.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa yin no zhe na yang ji tsam la rung ba nyid rgyu shes par dka'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa yin no zhe na yang ji tsam la rung ba nyid rgyu shes par dka'o //
translated: If you say that it is a cooperative condition because it is present in a suitable place, then it is difficult to understand how far a suitable place extends.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid nye bar len pa las skye ba ni de yod na mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir rten nyid yin gyi de de ltar skye ba tsam ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid nye bar len pa las skye ba ni de yod na mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir rten nyid yin gyi de de ltar skye ba tsam ni ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since it does not fall when it exists because it is produced from its own appropriated causes, the body is the basis of consciousness, but not merely its place of origin.üîΩIf you think that the body is the basis of consciousness because it exists for each mind,

original: lus kyi 'di yang sems re re la yod pa'i phyir de yang de'i rten du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi 'di yang sems re re la yod pa'i phyir de yang de'i rten du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then the body is not the basis of consciousness,üîΩjust as water, etc.,

original: gal te dper na chu sogs kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te dper na chu sogs kyi // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are not the basis of a reflection.

original: ltung ba bkag pas rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltung ba bkag pas rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the body is not a cause of consciousness because it prevents its falling.

original: lan ni 'di la 'ang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: lan ni 'di la 'ang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The reply is that the same is true here.

original: sems dang lus dag la /
analyzed: sems dang lus dag la /
translated: The body and consciousness

original: yod med dag la rten med phyir //
analyzed: yod med dag la rten med phyir //
translated: do not exist without a basis.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is what is stated in the verse.

original: 'di la yang chu dang don gzhan dag tu mtshungs pa yin te chu dang cig shos kyang nye bar len pa dang nye bar 'gro ba dag gi yul @252b mtshungs par skyed par byed pa la phan tshun phan 'dogs pa med pa ni rten dang brten pa nyid
analyzed: 'di la yang chu dang don gzhan dag tu mtshungs pa yin te chu dang cig shos kyang nye bar len pa dang nye bar 'gro ba dag gi yul @252b mtshungs par skyed par byed pa la phan tshun phan 'dogs pa med pa ni rten dang brten pa nyid
translated: Also, in this case, water and the other are similar. Water and the other are similar in that they generate the object of appropriation and the object of going. There is no mutual benefit in the absence of support and supported.

original: ma yin zhing skyes pa de gnyis kyi de dang 'dra ba gzhan gnyis yin la des kyang de dang 'dra ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir gang la yang phan 'dogs pa mad da //
analyzed: ma yin zhing skyes pa de gnyis kyi de dang 'dra ba gzhan gnyis yin la des kyang de dang 'dra ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir gang la yang phan 'dogs pa mad da //
translated: The two that are born are similar to those two, and because of that, the other two are similar. Therefore, there is no benefit for anything.

original: snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa 'bras bu'i rgyun 'ba' zhig gzhan yod na yang dag par dmigs pa snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid du mngon par sems pa ni rten nam cig shos su shas pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa 'bras bu'i rgyun 'ba' zhig gzhan yod na yang dag par dmigs pa snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid du mngon par sems pa ni rten nam cig shos su shas pa yin no //
translated: If the mere continuum of the effect that is dissimilar to the prior cause exists, the prior and subsequent are conceived to be the same. That is the conception of support or the other.

original: snga mas phyi ma la phan byed pa ni de'i dus su ma yin la /
analyzed: snga mas phyi ma la phan byed pa ni de'i dus su ma yin la /
translated: The prior does not benefit the subsequent at that time.

original: de ma yin pa'i dus su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i dus su yang ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin par de ltar brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

analyzed: dngos rnams skad cig re rer ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Things do not go in each instant.

original: skad cig gcig la 'gro ba srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la 'gro ba srid pa ma yin te /

original: skad cig gzhan na med pa'i phyir gang gegs byed pas rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: skad cig gzhan na med pa'i phyir gang gegs byed pas rten du 'gyur /

analyzed: nye bar len pa dang / yul tha dad pa'i 'bras bu kho na 'gro ba yin la /

analyzed: de yod na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar de la de'i dus su gegs mi byed pa yin /

analyzed: lus la gnas pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni yul na mi gnas par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yon tan dang spyi dang las rnams kyang 'gro ba med pa nyid yin la /

translated: The support of water, etc. is not substantially real.üîΩThe support of water

original: nye bar len pa dang nye bar 'gro ba dag gis skad cig de dag gi lhan cig skye ba tsam yin gyi phan tshun bya ba ci yang med la brtog  pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis de bzhin du skye ba tsam las 'dod pa grub pa yang ma yin
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang nye bar 'gro ba dag gis skad cig de dag gi lhan cig skye ba tsam yin gyi phan tshun bya ba ci yang med la brtog  pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis de bzhin du skye ba tsam las 'dod pa grub pa yang ma yin
translated: They are merely co-originated in that moment by appropriation and going, but they do not have any mutual activity at all. And it is not established that they are desired to be merely co-originated by the power of the cause of investigation,

original: te / bya ba'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro zhes @253a * //
analyzed: te / bya ba'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro zhes @253a * //
translated: because they do not exist at the time of activity.

original: bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: ma mthong ba nyid la mthong bar mngon par rlom pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid la mthong bar mngon par rlom pa yin no //
translated: One is merely conceited about seeing what is not seen.

original: de'i dus na bya ba med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dus na bya ba med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This teaches that at that time there is no activity at all:

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir brten pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir brten pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the support of grasping.

original: de dag skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyi rten nyid ni sems la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyi rten nyid ni sems la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The support of being the cause of their arising does not stop the continuum of mind and so on,

original: de log na de bzhin du skyes pa nyid ldog pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa la sogs pa las gzhan du skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de log na de bzhin du skyes pa nyid ldog pa'i phyir dang / nye bar len pa la sogs pa las gzhan du skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that were stopped, they would be stopped just as they arose, and because there is arising apart from appropriation and so on.

original: de'i dus kyi rten nyid la sems lus kyi nye bar len pa'am /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi rten nyid la sems lus kyi nye bar len pa'am /
translated: At that time, the mind is the appropriator of the body.üîΩ

original: de dang 'du ba can yang de log na ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'du ba can yang de log na ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is the support of the body, or it is associated with the body, and when the mind is reversed, the body is reversed.

original: sems dang yon tan nyid du phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar bsams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang yon tan nyid du phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar bsams pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can the mind be as it is intended, since there is no contact between the mind and its qualities?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúbecause of the existence and non-existence of entities.‚Äù

original: med pa ni snga na med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa ni snga na med pa yin gyi /
translated: Non-existence is prior non-existence,

original: gcig la gcig med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not mutual non-existence,

original: cig car ba yin pa'i phyir la de yang rgyu yod na yod pa kho nas de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car ba yin pa'i phyir la de yang rgyu yod na yod pa kho nas de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of simultaneity, and because of the existence of that very thing when its cause exists.

original: 'dis ni med pa 'joms pa bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'dis ni med pa 'joms pa bshad pa yin no ;
translated: This explains the destruction of non-existence.

original: / gang gi tshe 'dzin par byed pa'i rim pa dang / de'i rtogs bya gzung ba yang de bzhin du snang ba ni rim pa ma yin pa mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe 'dzin par byed pa'i rim pa dang / de'i rtogs bya gzung ba yang de bzhin du snang ba ni rim pa ma yin pa mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: When the order of the apprehender and the apprehended is such that the apprehender appears as the apprehended, it is quite unreasonable to say that the order is not so.

original: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'di'i bar du rten la sogs pa nyid 'bad pas bkag pa yin te de'i rtogs pa yin na bag chags tsam 'byung ba nyid kyis thog ma med pa nyid du gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub pa la gtan tshigs gzhan nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i
analyzed: 'di'i bar du rten la sogs pa nyid 'bad pas bkag pa yin te de'i rtogs pa yin na bag chags tsam 'byung ba nyid kyis thog ma med pa nyid du gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub pa la gtan tshigs gzhan nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i
translated: Up to this point, the existence of a basis and so on have been refuted through effort. If that were realized, then because of the mere arising of latent potentialities, the world would be clear from beginningless time. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the existence of other worlds is established by another reason,

original: don du / 'di ni rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don du / 'di ni rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis is mere imagination.‚Äù

original: bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid yin na yin na yid kyis rgyal srid kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin du nges pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid yin na yin na yid kyis rgyal srid kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin du nges pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it arises from mere latent potentialities, then, like the imagination of a kingdom by the mind, would it not be indeterminate?

original: yul nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rten la sogs pa nyid kyi yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rten la sogs pa nyid kyi yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for the determination of the object is taught to be the basis and so on.

original: skad cig re rer 'jig pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig re rer 'jig pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúof those that perish moment by moment.‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu nyid rten yin na de'i yul du rtog pa dngos po'i yul du 'gyur pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu nyid rten yin na de'i yul du rtog pa dngos po'i yul du 'gyur pa bstan pa ni /
translated: If the cause itself is the basis, then the object of that imagination would be an object of reality. This is taught by

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: The former and the latter are called ‚Äúthe two.‚Äù

original: de la gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis byas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis byas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The superimposition of identity is produced by beginningless latent propensities.

original: de'i dus kyi rten nyid yin na dngos su yin pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i shes pa gzhan bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi rten nyid yin na dngos su yin pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i shes pa gzhan bzhin du /
translated: If it were the basis of that time, it would be the direct cause, like the consciousness that apprehends it.

original: bag chags las @253b 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags las @253b 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would not arise from latent propensities.

original: de'i phyir rgyu nyid kyi ngo bo'i dngos po kho na 'jig rten pha rol 'grub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu nyid kyi ngo bo'i dngos po kho na 'jig rten pha rol 'grub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the entity that is the nature of the cause itself would not be the proof of the existence of the next world.

original: bden te / rgyu'i ngo bo'i rten la de nyid du sgro gtags pa ni de'i dus su rgyu ma yin pa la yang yin pa'i phyir bag chags kyi nus pa bsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te / rgyu'i ngo bo'i rten la de nyid du sgro gtags pa ni de'i dus su rgyu ma yin pa la yang yin pa'i phyir bag chags kyi nus pa bsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is true that the superimposition of identity in the basis of the nature of the cause is removed by the power of latent propensities because at that time, it is not the cause.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pha rol grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩyid kyi rtog pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pha rol grub pa yin par bstan pa ni / yid kyi rtog pa thams cad ni //
translated: Thus, the proof of the existence of the next world is presented:üîΩAll mental cognitions

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are produced from latent propensities.

original: rtog pa ni snang bzhin pa can gyi yul can ma yin nam khyad par can tsam yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa ni snang bzhin pa can gyi yul can ma yin nam khyad par can tsam yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
